agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Licensing & Administrative Procedures TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 9, 2019 PLACE: E2.028 CHAIR: Rep. Tracy King HB 201 Stephenson Relating to the composition of the combative sports advisory board. HB 4120 Lucio III Relating to the financial security requirement for providers obligated under certain service contracts. HB 2940 Geren Relating to the ownership, control, or operation of a franchised or nonfranchised dealer or dealership by certain motor vehicle manufacturers and distributors. HB 1568 Hernandez Relating to the authority of certain municipal employees to request the removal and storage of certain abandoned or illegally parked or operated vehicles. HB 2214 Hernandez Relating to the issuance of a temporary occupational license to certain military service members, military veterans, and military spouses. HB 2399 Goldman Relating to the use of a biometric identity verification device to comply with certain alcohol related laws. HB 469 Springer | et al. Relating to the sale of wine and beer on Sundays. HB 2165 Hernandez Relating to the sale by certain alcoholic beverage permit or license holders of alcoholic beverages at a cost below the cost to the seller. HB 1443 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to the certification of an area's wet or dry status for the purpose of an alcoholic beverage permit or license. HB 2171 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to activities that constitute the criminal offense of maintaining or assisting in maintaining a common nuisance. HB 2172 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to grounds for refusal of certain alcoholic beverage licenses and permits. HB 3842 King, Tracy O. Relating to the requirement that a motor vehicle dealer obtain a general distinguishing number for a consignment location. HB 4456 Geren Relating to the sale of alcoholic beverages in areas annexed or owned by certain municipalities. HB 1865 Landgraf Relating to the licensing and regulation of massage therapy; requiring a student permit; authorizing fees. HB 4296 Schaefer | et al. Relating to the high school instruction and licensure of a tradesman plumber, and waiver of certain fee requirements. HB 3077 King, Ken Relating to certain obligations of franchised dealers in connection with certain warranties for a new motor vehicle. HB 3222 King, Ken Relating to the creation of a nonresident brewer and nonresident manufacturer agent permit; authorizing a fee. HB 3622 Paddie | et al. Relating to the adoption of certain plumbing codes by the Texas State Board of Plumbing Examiners. HB 2747 Ortega Relating to the licensing and regulation of massage therapy. HB 3624 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to a reduced licensing fee for certain former license holders. HB 2792 Goldman Relating to making a false statement or false representation in certain documents filed with the Texas Alcoholic Beverage Commission. HB 2847 Goldman Relating to the licensing and regulation of certain occupations and activities; authorizing fees. HB 2403 Goldman Relating to the regulation of residential service companies and residential service contracts. HB 882 Bell, Cecil Relating to the duration of a bingo occasion. HB 1781 Goldman | et al. Relating to the supervision and control of plumbing work in the construction of certain dwellings. Bills added after last posting: HB 4120 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
